result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres S Gamez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
_________________________

Maintain employment, full time school or a combination of the two.  
_____________________

No contact with victim, her father, her siblings or their family members without each person's consent and Agent's approval. Contact between the defendant and his son will be at discretion of Agent. No unsupervised contact with any minors without Agent's consent. Agent would be the one to determine proper supervision. 
_____________________
Possess no weapons.
__________________

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
___________________
Register as a sex offender and comply with all rules of the registry and his agent. 
___________________
Comply with any evaluations that are required of him and follow through with any treatment recommendations made. 
__________________

8:30 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andres S Gamez in court, in custody with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing hearing.  Defendant was found guilty of sole count in the Information.  
8:30 am  Atty Stilling has reviewed the PSI with Mr. Gamez and did note additions / corrections in her sentencing memorandum.  Court has also reviewed the sentencing memorandum filed by the defense.  
8:31 am  Discussion concerning compliance with victim notification.  
8:31 am  Statement by victim I.Y.  
8:37 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
8:43 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Stilling.  
8:58 am  Statement by defendant.  
8:59 am  Court takes brief recess.  
9:10 am  Court in session.  Same appearances.  
9:10 am  Court proceeds with sentencing defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence is 14 years WSP:  IC:  7 years; ES:  7 years; 
71 days of sentence credit
Not eligible for CIP or SAP
CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  No contact with victim, her father, her siblings or their family members without each person's consent and Agent's approval.  Contact between the defendant and his son will be at discretion of Agent.  No unsupervised contact with any minors without Agent's consent.  Agent would be the one to determine proper supervision.  
2)  Register as a sex offender and comply with all rules of the registry and his Agent.  
3)  Comply with any evaluations that are required of him and follow through with any treatment recommendations made. 
4)  Maintain full time employment, full time school or a combination of the two.  
5)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
6)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  

Court warns deft:  1) May not vote until civil rights are restored;  2) May not possess firearms;  3) May not possess body armor;  4) May not work or volunteer with children;  9:34 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing Memorandum Sentencing Memorandum attachments

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen and Diane Mullins;

8:19 am  No objection by Atty Stilling to #1 on State's list of statements.  Argument by Attorneys as to the other proposed statements the State wishes to introduce.

Atty Stilling indicates that Mr. Gamez has made the decision that he wishes to testify.

State had rested yesterday.  The State has a stipulation as to agreed testimony which the State intended to present.  Court reads stipulated testimony of Tom Parsons of Timber-lee into the record.  .

Defense wants to play a video and the State is objecting.   
Court asks what the relevance is as to the playing of a video of the 3 boys?     
Response by Atty Stilling.  
Court does not see the relevance of showing a video of the 3 boys and Court believes it would be prejudicial.

ADA Johnson indicates her questions relate to jail calls and she did not want to reference them that way.  Atty Stilling says she did have access to DVD recordings of jail calls and has listened to them but does not have transcript of those calls.  Continued argument by Attys.  Court does not believe the State has done anything wrong.  Response by Atty Stilling.  Atty Johnson states she does not have transcripts of the phone calls but has made her own notes of what was said during the calls as she listened to them.  
11:26 am  Jurors return to courtroom.  Court advises that objection has been overruled.  
11:26 am  Continued cross exam by Atty Johnson.

12:17 pm  Court wishes to address issue as whether Dr. Thompson can testify as to fetal alcohol syndrome and effects on memory and intellect capacity.  
12:18 pm  Argument by Atty Stilling.  
12:23 pm  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
12:25 pm  Response by Atty Stilling.  
12:27 pm  Court notes that this is actually a continuance of a Daubert hearing.  Court makes record and does not believe the proffered testimony is relevant.  Court does not find there is neutral unbiased professional evidence that Isabella is affected in that way.  There has never been an indication that she has an intellectual or a memory problem.    Court is denying the request to have Dr. Thompson testify with regard to the effects of fetal alcohol syndrome.  Questions of clarification by Atty Stilling with regard to Dr. Thompson's testimony.  Response by Court.  He can point out suggestive or improper questions but cannot comment on her answers.  Court makes record with regard to the 2nd interview - only the first interview was a forensic interview.  Response by Attys.  Response by Court.  
12:38 pm  Court in recess.  

1:31 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court wishes to make one further point with regard to her FAS decision.  Court makes record with regard to her assessment of Isabella.  
1:33 pm  Attorney Johnson has no further record to make on this.  Response by Atty Stilling.

4:40 pm  Court ruled it was not an other acts analysis under Sullivan; that the information was contextually needed to explain the background; it was admissible as bias evidence;  
4:41 pm  Court has colloquy with Mrs. Gamez about what could be said and what could not be said.  She cannot go into why she got divorced.  Court finds it is a prior inconsistent statement.  Court will allow the question to be asked and answered.  Court asks if there are any other questions Atty Stilling intends to illicit that the court should address now.  4:44 pm  Response by Atty Stilling.  4:45 pm  Response by Atty Johnson as to questions she intends to ask Ms. Gamez about conversations she had with Mr. Gamez.

4:00 pm  Atty Stilling is going to request that the Court allow Atty Stilling to allow her to introduce some of Madison's statements.  She is asking the Court to make a finding pursuant to Sec. 908.04(1)(d) that Madison is not available.  Response by Atty Johnson.  Court concurs that the defense has shown that the witness is unavailable and makes record with regard to their efforts.  Court declares her to be unavailable.  Atty Stilling says there are 2 statements she is asking be introduced.  Response by Atty Johnson.  Court makes record as to its ruling a couple of weeks ago with regard to a statement that the Court had disallowed.  Response by Atty Johnson as to the statement the defense is now requesting be introduced.  4:13 pm  Court makes record as to its ruling and will allow the one phrase that the defense wishes to introduce.  Court believes it meets the criteria.  There are actually 2 statements that the Court will allow to be introduced.  Court understands that the State may have statements they wish to introduce.  Court will address this in the morning at 8:15 am.  4:18 pm  Court in recess.

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen and Diane Mullins;  
8:32 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Andres S Gamez in court with Attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  
Court had asked parties to make a record with regard to offers and the defendant's intent to refuse those.  
Atty Johnson makes record as to State's offer.  Response by Atty Stilling.  
Court has colloquy with Mr. Gamez with regard to State's officer.  He doesn't recall being advised of the offer.  
8:34 am  Court takes recess to allow Atty Stilling to discuss State's offer with him.  
8:38 am  Court back in session.  Atty Stilling has discussed the offer with Mr. Gamez and he confirms he is not accepting State's offer.  
8:39 am  Court now addresses the pattern instruction with regard to burden or proof.  Argument by Attorneys.  Court is convinced by the offer of proof that the committee has decided to add the language to footnote 5 of the instruction.  Court indicates it is still a matter of discretion for the Court.  Court does not have a joint recommendation here by the Attorneys.  Court does not see the need for the additional instruction as all of that information is already in the instruction itself.  
8:46 am  Court next addresses criminal convictions of any witnesses with the Attorneys.  
8:48 am  Court now has the list of witnesses or people who may be mentioned during the trial.  Atty Stilling has a couple of names to add to the list.  
8:51 am  Court addresses request of Atty Stilling to read Instruction 145.  Court will read it in its voir dire questioning of jurors.  Discussion with regard to statement that parties agreed could come in from defendant's statement.  Discussion concerning jury instructions 161, 275 and 2104.  
8:56 am  Atty Johnson makes record with regard her objection to text messages that she has been provided by the Defense.  8:57 am  Argument by Atty Stilling.  8:59 am  Response by Atty Johnson.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court reviews text messages provided by Atty Stilling.  Court indicates it is up to the State as to whether or not they wish to introduce testimony about the Ipod - if either party wants to introduce it they can but should not just be selected portions of the messages.  Discussion between court and attorneys concerning testimony of Jenna.  Discussion concerning "Crawford" issue.  
9:15 am  Court in recess.  

OFF THE COURT RECORD:  Clerk takes roll call of Jurors in the JURY ASSEMBLY ROOM.  Clerk gives Oath of Competency to Jurors.  Clerk calls names of the 24 jurors who are to be seated in the jury box.  Bailiff brings those Jurors up to courtroom and Clerk seats them in jury box.  Bailiff brings up remaining jurors who are seated in back of the courtroom.

11:05 am  Court takes short recess to allow Jurors to have a break.

11:21 am  Court takes short recess.  
11:24 am  Continued voir dire by Atty Stilling.

12:17 pm  Jurors who were not selected are excused.

12:27 pm  Jurors are excused for lunch and asked to return at 1:45 pm.  
12:28 pm  No objection by Attys to Instructions as read by Court.  
12:28 pm  Court in recess.  

1:45 pm  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
3:09 pm  ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Andres S Gamez in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  
Case is set for trial to start next week.  This is the #1 case for trial;  State is ready to proceed.  Atty Stilling has one missing witness and a newly unavailable witness.  Atty Stilling makes record with regard to the witness they have not yet been able to serve with a subpoena.  Atty Stilling is asking for an adjournment.  Atty Johnson makes record that the State is objecting to the motion for continuance.  Court is not going to grant the defendant's request for a continuance.  Court notes this was filed in July of 2015 and the offense date is from July of 2014.  Court makes record with regard to the history of this case.  There has been an ongoing process with the defense trying to get service of witnesses in Illinois.  Court is not going to reschedule the jury trial.  3:22 pm  Court takes recess before addressing motions in limine.  

3:44 pm  Continuation of final pre-trial.  Court will seat 2 alternates.  They will remain on the case through closing instructions and closing arguments.  Atty Johnson asks for exclusion order except for the State's court officer, the victim and victim's parents.  Atty Stilling asks that the victim and her parents not be in the courtroom until they testify.  Court cites Sec. 906.15.  Court believes the victim or a representative for the victim has a right to be present in the courtroom.  Response by Atty Stilling as to another section of the Statute.  Response by Court that it's ruling will remain.  

3:57 pm  Court addresses Defense Motions in Limine.  1) - Argument by Attys - Court is not prepared to make a pre-trial ruling on - will have to be addressed if and when it comes up at trial;  2) - Bad acts evidence - certain acts were allowed by Judge Reddy; State does not have anything more to introduce; 3) - Discussion concerning any prior convictions of witnesses; defendant has 1 prior when he was 18; Argument by Attorneys; denied with regard to deft's prior; unknown if witnesses have records;  4) - Witnesses and discovery has been provided; 5) - Already dealt with this; 6) - All discovery has been provided by State; 7) Atty Stilling asked that she not name other members of law office; Court asks that ADA Johnson introduce other members of her office;  8) - Granted; 9) - already dealt with; 10) - Court makes record as to preliminary instructions she will read; Court will allow jury questions only if both Attys agree to this procedure.  Atty Stilling objects to jurors being allowed to ask questions; 11) - Granted; 
Atty Stilling has 1 modified instruction which would be Jury Instruction 140;  There is a proposal for added language to the Instruction which has not yet been officially added. Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court is not opposed if Atty Stilling can show the Court that this is something that the committee has approved and it's a matter of just getting it done.  
Discussion between Court and Attys concerning Dr. Thompson's testimony.  Court asks that Attys be present in Court at 8:30 am Monday morning.  Court will make a record on Monday morning as to any offers made by the State and rejected by the defense.  4:29 pm  Court in recess.
Defense
Memorandum in Support of Modification of Pattern Jury Instruction
Notice of Motion and Motion In Limine

2:41 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kathleen Byrne Stilling appears on person on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Andres S Gamez is not present.  Mr. Gamez was supposed to call in.
Atty Stilling gives update on what is happening in Illinois with regard to trying to get a witness here to testify for trial.  Atty Still is not asking for an adjournment at this time and asks that this remain on as scheduled.  Atty Johnson doesn't have anything to add at this time.  Court will not make a detailed record today as the defendant is not here but Court is not inclined to continue this whether or not they are able to get the witness here.  If a motion is filed, the Court will consider it.  Response by Attorney Still that she will continue to prepare for trial. Discussion by Attys concerning availability of Dr. Thompson for trial.  2:46 pm  Court in recess.

3:37 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andres S Gamez in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  
Matter is on this afternoon to hopefully finalize the pending Motions.  
The only Motion that still might require evidence or a witness is the motion to suppress with regard to the Defendant's statement.  Atty Johnson did subpoena the officer but then had a conversation with the Officer and found out that his discussion with the defendant was very short.  ADA Johnson intends to play the beginning portion of the video which is approximately 1 minute long.  
3:42 pm  Atty Johnson plays video recording for Court.  
3:50 pm  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
3:51 pm  Argument by Atty Stilling.  
3:5 Court has read through the entire transcript of interview between the officer and defendant.  Court finds this is clearly a Miranda type situation and the defendant was in custody.  He was at a police department and was in an interview room.  There is no argument by the State that he was not in custody.  According to State v Hampton and a variety of other cases, the State needs to show by preponderance of evidence that defendant knowinglyand intellingently waived his rights.  The officer was speaking quickly but you could understand him.  In Court's opinion he was advised of his rights and was asked if he understood them.  he answered in the affirmative and continued to speak with them and answer their questions.  For reasons State forth.  Court finds that the State has met its burden of proof.  Court denies defense's motion to suppress the statements pursuant to Miranda.  There has been no challenge to the voluntariness of his statements.  Court does not find tha there would be any challenge under a Goodchild type of motion. 

Court next deals with Defense's request to expand some of the portions of the defendant's statement that the State had intended to use.  Court has the letter submitted by Atty Stilling.  
#1 - Court will allow page 12, line 19 through page 19, line 15; 
#2 - Atty Stilling had asked that page 32, line 15, through page 33, line 9, be added;  State has no objection.  State can introduce starting at page 32, line 15 through to page 41, line 5; Defense is asking for portions to be redacted.  Court agrees with the defense concerns - State can introduce page 32, line 15 through page 40, line 13; 
#3 - Page 46 - instead of starting at line 18, to start at line 9 and both parties agree to go through page 56, line 21; 
"Tracking periods" - Page 116 of transcript; State wants to introduce line 20 through page 121, line 4 - Defense has no objection; Next, backing up page 111 line 5 through page 113, line 10; State has no objection to stopping at page 113 through line 3; "Camp discussion":  No objection by defense to portions that State wishes to use in their case in chief;  

Court next addresses the objection by the State to proposed testimony of Dr. Thompson.  
Court has reviewed all the written materials submitted by the parties.  
4:16 pm  Argument by Attorneys.  
4:27 pm  Court makes record and references Sec. 907.02.  Case law makes it clear that the Court is to act as a gatekeeper.  Court makings findings.  1) Defense wants Dr. Thompson to testify with regard to memory.  He cannot and would not testify as to whether her memory has been affected.  Court does think that testimony with regard to memory as proposed by the defense is relevant.  Court finds that this proffered testimony is material and reliable.  2)  Court will not allow testimony with regard to common behaviors and characteristics in the adolescent's age group.  Court will also not allow testimony with regard to the adolescent brain development;  3)  Next issue would be testimony with regard to fetal alcohol syndrome.  Atty Stilling asks that the Court not rule on this today.  Atty Stilling believes there will be more information that will come in through other testimony.  Court will allow this to be revisited outside presence of jury before he would testify.  Court makes record under 904.03 - Court does think it has probative value and court does not think that the probative  value would be substantially outweighed by prejudice to the State.  Court does not want there to be any questions or topic areas that would induce an answer that is in violation of Hazeltine.    Next Motion is the defendan't motion with regard to other acts.  Court makes record as to evidence that the defense wishes to be able to introduce.  Court does not believe this is a 904.04(2) analysis - this is not other acts so Court will not do a Sullivan analysis.  Court makes findings with regard to the divorce of the parents.  Court will allow testimony to come in that it was an ugly divorce; that one or both parents put the children in middle and that for a period of time pursuant to court order the father could not have contact with the children - or that it had to be supervised contact with the children.  There is to be no evidence as to why they got divorced.  Court next addresses page 2 of the defendant's motion to exclude - February 23rd 1) Allowing that to come in under the context decision with the exception of the final 8 words.  2) Not admissible; 3) Not admissible; 4) Not admissible; not relevant; 5) The first half (court reads into record) is allowed; but Court does not believe her responses are allowed; Court hears argument of Attorneys; 6)  Court questions relevance as to #6; response by Atty Stilling.  Response by Atty Johnson; Court will not make a ruling at this time; 7)  Atty Johnson does not object;  

5:10 pm  Atty Stilling makes record with regard to an out-of-state witness (Madison) they have been attempting to get served with a subpoena for trial.  Atty Stilling will know more tomorrow.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to witness.  Court sets further status conference Friday afternoon, March 10th at 2:30 pm.  Atty Still and the defendant can appear by phone.  

5:20 pm  Court in recess.

9:10 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State;  
Deft Andres S Gamez in court with Atty  Kathleen Stilling.  
Matter is before the Court today for a status conference and a Motion by the State to Introduce the videotaped statement of child.  
Court asks questions regarding mother's criminal case in Illinois.  
Atty Stilling advises that it was dismissed.  
Court asks about documents from Illinois that were to be produced for in camera review.  
Atty Stilling advises that investigative records relating to child and family services were turned over to the Illinois defense atty.  
The Illinois Judge indicated he could release those records to Deft's  Illinois Atty and he has provided those documents to Atty Stilling.  Atty Stilling will be providing those to Atty Johnson.  
As to the school records, the Illinois Judge has subpoenaed those for an incamera inspection.  It is expected that he would release records to this Court after review.  
9:17 am  Atty Johnson prefers that any records that may be released by the Illinois Judge after doing an incamera inspection be released to this Court for an incamera inspection.  
Atty Stilling advises that there is no trial date currently set in Illinois.  
Court makes record that any other records still being reviewed by the Illinois Judge need to be subject to an incamera review by this Court.  
Court asks that the parties advise the Illinois Judge that the school records and any other records that are produced be submitted to this Court for incamera review and not released directly to the parties.  .  
Atty  Stilling will send a letter to the Illinois Attorney letting him know what this Court has ordered with regard to release of any records.  
Atty Stilling will be filing a  motion in limine with respect to the interrogation. 
The only other matter for the Court to consider today is the State's Motion to Introduce the Statement of victim.  
Court has reviewed the videotaped statement and the written responses filed by Attys.  
9:25 am  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
9:30 am  Argument by Atty Stilling.  
9:48 am  Rebuttal argument by Atty Johnson.  
9:50 am  Response by Atty Stilling. 
9:51 am  Court makes record.  Court believes victim was old enough to have been given an Oath or Affirmation which was not done.  She was also not asked about the difference between the truth and a lie.  Court rules that it cannot admit the statement under Sec. 908.08(3).  Court next addresses 908.08(7) and 908.03(24) and makes record.  Court rules that victim will need to testify and will not admit the videotaped statement. Court returns DVD recording of Statement to Atty Johnson.  
10:05 am  Atty Stilling will file Motion in Limine and  Petitions for material witness warrants with the Court next week.  
10:06 am  Court in recess.

3:06 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andres S Gamez in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  
Matter is before the Court on the defendant's Daubert Motion.  
The Court did ask his clerk to share a Court of Appeals Decision in State vs Larry Smith with the Attorneys.  The Court understands there is another portion to the defendant's Daubert Motion.  Court asks if it goes to the weight and not the admissibility of Ms. Hocking's testimony?  Discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to relevancy.  Attorney Johnson is still not convinced that this witness has any disability.  
Continued discussion as to any records that may exist.  Attorney Stilling does not have the records yet that she has requested.  Court notes that the diagnosis that we are aware of now was made when the victim was an infant.  Court finds that based upon St vs Smith there is a sufficient basis for Ms. Hocking's testimony.  As far as relevancy is concerned, the Court does not believe there has been a sufficent showing by the Defense to rise to level of concerns that this child has such extreme disabilities to make the testimony irrelevant.  Court denies the Motion at this time but will leave the door open to revisit this if there is additional information provided to the Court.  

Argument by Attorney Stilling with regard to the State's Expert's Summary of Ms. Hocking's testimony.  She asks the Court to Order the State to provide a summary of expert's testimony that is relevant to this particular case.  Attorney Johnson indicates it is a summary, and it is not intended to limit the witness' testimony to the summary.  A copy of the State's Summary has been marked as Exhibit #1 and the Ms. Hocking's CV is Exhibit #2.  Response by Attorney Stilling.  The Court notes that if there is some testimony solicited with respect to recantation, the defense would always have the ability to object to relevancy at that time.  The Court does not wish to make any rulings at this time.  

State estimates having 7 witnesses.  Attorney Stilling estimates 5 witnesses or maybe more.  Attorney Still believes 5 days will be required for trial.  

Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH I.B.Y. (DOB 05/21/2001) OR RESIDENCE.   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
